review: It would be 100x better if it didn't require being plugged into an outlet AND being plugged into the TV. Only makes for more chords. Wish it could self charge through the TV.It is nice so far other than that.

review: It "buffers" frequently, and gets hot. I frequently have to reboot it. I probably should have probably paid the extra to get a Roku.
author: Bobby Moore

review: I couldn't be anymore pleased! What a wonderful alternative. This was easy to set up and I began using it immediately.
author: S. Sayre "Sandy"

review: Bought this as a gift for my sister to use with her bedroom tv.  It was easy to hook up and the remote is a great bonus.  I bought a Google Chromecast last year for my bedroom tv and the Firestick far exceeds it in variety of channels and user friendly
author: Mary Jane Cook

review: I Just installed it and am still learning.  It was easy to install, but, like all things, it's easier if your are computer savvy.  For example, it lists three steps durng installation.  One of which is "connect to internet."  I thought it meant to my internet server, Cox, but, discovered it meant to connect to my WIFI.  Luckily I had installed WIFI for my Kindle.  Like everything today, it's easier if a person is computer savvy.One other thing I noticed is that, if you click on a movie, it comes on immediately.  There is no info about whether or not a cost is involved; i.e., when I go to a movie on my Kindle, it lists an amount if a cost is involved.Anyway, I'm still learning and would appreciate more info as to how the Fire Stick works.
author: Nanette Ouellet

review: Got it for my mom, she doesn't have a smart TV so I thought this would be perfect for her, she loves her old cowboy movies, she loves John Wayne so this was perfect. And it works great, easy setup. Next I think I'll get the remote with voice control... At least I think it works with it. Definitely recommend it. Can't beat the price.
author: Terry Diorio
